review: I recently bought a macbook air (already own a few ipads, and iphones) and this product really makes viewing movies on my TV easy. Previously, I was using a Western digital WebTv HD with a jump drive to stream movies. It was a little cumbersome having to load the movie onto a jump drive or hard drive before I can watch a movie. Now I can just stream it right off my laptop, iphone, or ipad. Also the user interface is easy to navigate and use my HBO Go account.
author: Stephen V. Le

review: I have an apple centric set up so it was natural for me to choose this over the competing Roku3.  I was worried though as I obtain my movies via DVD and BR rather than through iTunes.I adjusted my ripping process to target the ATV standards and along with iFlicks I have a great workflow for my content.  For playing back the device is great.  Airplay from my iOS or iMac works better than I expected and this makes up for the lack of Amazon Prime on the device.I took a star off because the device does not support DTS or higher audio standards and it also is not capable of transmitting 3D, so I still have to use my PS3 and 3D bluray disks for that.  If it did, I could place my entire collection on my media server....

review: The remote is minimalistic to a fault. No Amazon Prime which stinks, the Netflix UI pales in comparison to the XBOX one, some shows will not play more than 1 season and there are other issues.  The internet connection is always awesome and while they are always adding new "channels", most of them are require a paid subscription or cable service to access, which makes it difficult when you are cutting the cord from cable so to speak.  It should have a browser as well, would that really be a big deal to add mobile Safari or something?When I was adding a tv in the basement the plan was to get a tv and apple tv, but after using this one in our bedroom for a few months we decided just to get a Samsung smart tv.  Basically the same thing with more features all built in.
